subject: Letter # 27
msgSnippet: I have something about which I would like to hear what people on this list think: I like the Kingsley (and KingPlus) font, but letter #27 (EA-t) in Read s
messageBody:
I have something about which I would like to hear what people on this
list think:

I like the Kingsley (and KingPlus) font, but letter #27 (EA-t) in
Read's manual is written with a steep slope up, then a vertical line
down. This makes more sense to me than how it is displayed in the
Kingsley font. To my eyes the font letter is too close to the shape of
letter #40 (OO-ze). I realize that subtle differences in letters are
easily recognized with experience, but distinct differences help
readability, and ease learning.

Thanks to everyone who helps maintain this group!

Paul

I have something about which I would like to hear what people on this 
list think:

I like the Kingsley (and KingPlus) font, but letter #27 (EA-t) in 
Read's manual is written with a steep slope up, then a vertical line 
down. This makes more sense to me than how it is displayed in the 
Kingsley font. To my eyes the font letter is too close to the shape of 
letter #40 (OO-ze). I realize that subtle differences in letters are 
easily recognized with experience, but distinct differences help 
readability, and ease learning.

Thanks to everyone who helps maintain this group!

Paul
